title.value: Соответсвие фаз развития кормовых культур для приготовления бобово-злаковых травяных кормов
Feed crops development stages conformity for legume-cereal grass forage

subject.value: etapas de desarrollo de la planta

journal.title: Agriculture and Plant Protection : scientific-practical journal

person.name: Kovaleva, I.V., Vitebsk State Academy of Veterinary Medicine (Belarus)

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented research into analysis of calendar dates of the onset of phenological phases of plant development of millet (Panicum miliaceum) and sorghum crops and length of their interphase periods. During the study there were analysed seedlings of goat's rue (Galega orientalis L.) and alfalfa (Medicago sativa) sown in 2010. In order to determine the occurrence of technical maturity and productivity of annual crops with high energy value (millet, Indian barnyard millet (Echinochloa frumentacea), sorghum) there were crops used of 2012. In course of the study there were shown the characteristics of the formation of green mass of the perennial legumes grasses. There was developed a scheme of selection of high-energy annual crops with the aim of production of canned animal feed in conjunction with legumes. Study of the running phases of development of fodder crops made it possible to develop a selection scheme of low-cost annual heat-loving plants for the preparation of canned grass fodder in conjunction with bean component that increases the amount of protein in the diet and reduces the share of the costly, causing liver disease concentrates.
